title: About Me
text:
Welcome! I’ve been a healthcare data analytics professional for two years, supporting community health data management, impact evaluation, and accreditation at Kaiser Permanente. Prior to this, I conducted descriptive analytics for Social Determinants of Health research.
I’m drawn to collaborating, building and deploying R solutions for clean, efficient data workflows.
In my free time, I enjoy aerial hammock, cooking Sweetgreen dupes, and reading sci-fi.

PROJECTS

title: GitHub Actions News API
text:
A news feed for tech-related news, deployed and refreshed by Github Actions.

Using the News API, I pull top articles for the API category ‘Technology’ as well as keywords ‘Cybersecurity’, ‘DOGE’, and ‘OpenAI’. The json results are cleaned and formatted into an interactive table.



Website preview


Clicking anywhere in a table row opens the full-length article. Additionally, hovering over table headers reveals a descriptive text.



Tooltip text


The website refreshes itself each Sunday through Github Actions. For full details, please see the following:

WEBSITE


CODE (REPO)

title: CMS Research Payments Quarto
text:
Quarto dashboard of Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services research payments made in 2023.



Preview



Practitioners, teaching hospitals, and healthcare companies must disclose payments to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services annually.
This Quarto dashboard analyzes research payments made to practitioners and institutions in 2023. It is intended for health professionals, journalists, and curious members of the public to see which disciplines receive high research activity, and who are key funding recipients.
Read more at:

DASHBOARD


CODE (REPO)

title: Apache Arrow for Dispatch Calls
text:
How I leveraged Apache Arrow to analyze NYCs EMS Dispatch calls from 2007-2023.

In resource-limited and siloed organizations, data sharing is cumbersome. This is especially the case when departments without a shared platform must collaboratively process datasets. This inspired me to leverage Apache Arrow as a means to ingest, process, and analyze big data.



Apache Arrow logo


This project uses New York City dispatch calls data from 2007 to 2024. The EMS Incident Dispatch Data contains 27M records detailing incident location, perceived call severity, and Fire Department response time.



Call codes distribution


For full details, please see the following:

REPORT
